summary: This document is a chain of email correspondence from February 2020 among U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) staff regarding travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation (2018R01618). It details planning for a witness interview in Pensacola, Florida, and references numerous prior trips for interviews in locations including Los Angeles, West Palm Beach, and Stockholm, Sweden.

persons.name: Alex
persons.context: Primary author of the travel approval requests for the Epstein investigation team, coordinating logistics for witness interviews.

persons.name: Darlene Alleyne
persons.context: Recipient of travel logistics requests; tasked with booking flights, hotels, and conference rooms for the investigation team.

persons.name: Edward Tyrrell
persons.context: Approving authority for the travel requests related to the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: Michele Duncan
persons.context: Copied on travel approval requests, asks clarifying questions about travel details.

persons.name: Cynthia Perez
persons.context: Routinely copied on the travel approval email correspondence.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Member of the Epstein investigation team who travels for witness interviews, mentioned as a traveler to Pensacola and West Palm Beach.

persons.name: Maurene
persons.context: Member of the Epstein investigation team who travels for witness interviews, mentioned as a traveler to West Palm Beach and originally planned for Pensacola.

persons.name: Nick Siu
persons.context: Mentioned as the recipient for conference room payment requests.

connections.description: Alex submits travel approval requests to Edward Tyrrell, who approves them.
Alex coordinates with Darlene Alleyne to handle travel logistics like flight and hotel bookings.
Both are members of the Epstein investigation team who travel together for witness interviews.
Both are members of the Epstein investigation team who travel together for witness interviews.
Both are investigators/attorneys on the Epstein case, mentioned as alternative travel pairs for interviews.
Michele Duncan follows up with Darlene Alleyne on travel authorization and logistics.

events.title: Witness Interview in Pensacola
events.description: Planned interview of a witness in Pensacola, Florida, conducted by Alex and Alison from the SDNY Epstein investigation team.

events.title: Interview near Stockholm, Sweden
events.description: Reference to a prior planned interview near Stockholm, Sweden, with an international element, for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview(s) in Los Angeles
events.description: Reference to a prior trip for an interview or interviews in Los Angeles for the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Interview in West Palm Beach
events.description: Reference to a prior interview in West Palm Beach, Florida, conducted by Alex and Maurene.

events.title: Victim Interview in Los Angeles
events.description: Reference to a prior trip for a victim interview in Los Angeles for the Epstein investigation.

keyFacts: The document reveals ongoing, active investigation into the Epstein case (2018R01618) by the SDNY as of February 2020, involving travel for witness interviews.
The investigation involved international travel, including a planned interview near Stockholm, Sweden, in January 2020.
Multiple U.S. locations were used for interviews, primarily West Palm Beach, Florida, and Los Angeles, California, indicating a geographically broad witness pool.
The correspondence shows a standardized process for travel approval and logistics (flights, hotels, conference rooms) within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Epstein investigation.
The team composition for interviews varied, including prosecutors/investigators Alex, Alison, and Maurene.
